## getDataOrThrow() function

Get a data attribute's value from an element, optionally passing it through a reviver function to transform its value.

**Signature:**

```typescript
declare function getDataOrThrow<T = string>(element: HTMLElement, name: string, reviver?: (value: string) => T): T;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

element


</td><td>

HTMLElement


</td><td>

The element to get the data from.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

name


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

The name of the data attribute.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

reviver


</td><td>

(value: string) =&gt; T


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ A function to transform the result.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

T

## Exceptions

SyntaxError - If no data is found.

## Example 1

Get an element's data.

```ts
const result = getDataOrThrow(element, 'foo');
```

## Example 2

Get an element's data and transform the result.

```ts
const result = getDataOrThrow(element, 'foo', (value) => `The value is: ${value}`);
```

## Example 3

Get an element's data and parse as a number.

```ts
const result = getDataOrThrow(element, 'foo', parseFloat);
```

## Example 4

Get an element's data and parse as a boolean (using [parseBoolean()](./spank-my-dom.parseboolean.md)<!-- -->).

```ts
const result = getDataOrThrow(element, 'foo', parseBoolean);
```
